text:
e="preserve">Allene Roberts Cochran (September 1, 1928 – May 9, 2019) was an American actress. She was born in Fairfield, Alabama. Her first movie role was "The Red House" (1947) starring Rory Calhoun, Julie London and Edward G. Robinson. She starred in "Knock on Any Door", "Union Station" and "Bomba on Panther Island".
Roberts died on May 9, 2019 in Huntsville, Alabama at the age of 90.
